poem:
Title: "Appeal Upon Rafah's Dawn"

Of crimson cries and olive sighs,
the ceaseless knell of Gaza rings.
By waiting trucks, a silent plea unfolds - 
"Truly flood Gaza," he boldly tells.
A prayer of aid, whispered amid desert winds,
By the UN chief, weary of nightmares.
Fruitless orchards yearn for peace's rainy kiss,
Gaza's dream of floods, yet not of tears, persists.
